particle: The name of particles in the beam.
mass: The restmass of the particles in the beam.
charge: The electrical charge of the particles in the beam in units of the proton charge
gamma: Relativistic factor, ie the ratio between total energy and rest energy of the particles.
beta: Ratio between the speed of the particles and the speed of light.
sequence: Attaches the beam command to a specific sequence.
kbunch: The number of particle bunches in the machine.
npart: The number of particles per bunch.
bunched: The beam is treated as bunched whenever this makes sense.
radiate: Synchrotron radiation is considered in all bipolar magnets.
bv: The direction of the particle movement in a beam line.

file: The named file is read until a RETURN statement is encountered, or until the EOF.

sequence: Sequence for which the constraint applies.
range: Position where the constraint must be satisfied.

calls: Maximum number of calls to the penalty function

deltap: Difference between the reference momentum and the design momentum, divided by the design momentum.

bborbit: The closed orbit is modified by beam-beam kicks
echo: Echoes the input on the standard output file
echomacro: Issues macro expansion printout for debugging
no_fatal_stop: Prevents madx from stopping in case of a fatal error
rbarc: Converts the RBEND straight length into the arc length
reset: Resets all options to their defaults
sympl: All element matrices are symplectified in Twiss
tell: Prints the current value of all options
threader: Enables the threader for closed orbit finding in Twiss
trace: Prints the system time after each command
twiss_print: Controls whether the twiss command produces output
verify: Issues a warning if an undefined variable is used

errors_out: Write out multiple errors in EFCOMP table format
even: Even number of splits when using RESPLIT
exact: If true exact Hamiltonian is used
magnet_name: Magnet names to be used for error write out
offset_deltap: Relative momentum deviation of the reference particle.
time: Which coordinate system to use depending on 5D or 6D calculation.

closed_orbit: Turn on the closed orbit calculation.
deltap: Relative momentum offset for reference closed orbit
map_table: Turn on the map-table in memory
normal: Turn on the calculation of the Normal Form

fx: Action-angle coordinate expressed by normalized amplitude $\varPhi_x$.
phix: Action-angle coordinate expressed by normalized amplitude $F_y$.
fy: Action-angle coordinate expressed by normalized amplitude $F_y$.
phiy: Action-angle coordinate expressed by normalized amplitude $\varPhi_x$.
ft: Action-angle coordinate expressed by normalized amplitude $F_y$.
phit: Action-angle coordinate expressed by normalized amplitude $\varPhi_t$.

beam_envelope: Turn on the calculations of the beam envelope with PTC
closed_orbit: Turn on the closed orbit calculation
deltap: Relative momentum offset for reference closed orbit (used for 5D case ONLY)
element_by_element: Switch from the default turn-by-turn tracking to the element-by-element tracking
file: The name of the file output will be written to
ffile: Printing coordinates after every FFILE turns
icase: User-defined dimensionality of the phase-space (4, 5 or 6)
maxaper: Upper limits for the particle coordinates
norm_out: Transform canonical variables to action-angle variables
radiation: Turn on the synchrotron radiation calculated by an internal procedure of PTC
radiation_energy_loss: Adds the energy loss for radiation_model1
radiation_model1: Turn on the radiation according to the method given in the Ref
recloss: Create in memory a table named ”trackloss” containing the coordinates of lost particles.
space_charge: Turn on the simulations of the space charge forces between particles
turns: Number of turns to be tracked

class: The class of elements to be selected.
clear: Deselects ALL positions in the sequence for the flag ”name”.
flag: Determines the applicability of the SELECT statement.
full: The default for the MAKETHIN flag and for tables
pattern: The regular expression pattern for the element names to be selected.
range: The range of elements to be selected.
sequence: The name of a sequence to which the selection is applied.
slice: The number of slices into which the selected elements have to be cut. Only used by MAKETHIN and FLAG=INTERPOLATE
thick: Indicate whether the selected elements are treated as thick elements by the MAKETHIN command.

format: Format output. Must double-quote each format.

command: Print the command with the values of all its parameters.

detune: If true, the detune subroutine is executed
distort1: If true, the distort1 subroutine is executed
distort2: If true, the distort2 subroutine is executed
multipole_order_range: Longitudinal interval of the beam line (in m)
noprint: If true, no file or internal table will be created to keep the results
nosixtrack: If true, the input file fc.34 will not be generated internally by invoking the conversion routine of sixtrack and the user should provide it before the execution of the sodd command
print_all: If true, the files and internal tables containing results at each multipole will be generated
print_at_end: If true, the files and internal tables containing results at the end of the position range will be generated
start_stop: Longitudinal interval of the beam line (in m)

beta0: The name of a BETA0 block containing the Twiss parameters to be used as input.
centre: Enforce the calculation of the linear lattice functions at the center of the element instead of the end of the element.
deltap: Energy difference, divided by the reference momentum times the velocity of light.
Difference between the reference momentum and the design momentum, divided by the design momentum.
energy: The total energy per particle in.
file: The name of the file TWISS output will be written to
keeporbit: Store the orbit under this name at the start, and at all monitors.
line: Name of a valid beamline for which the calculation of optical functions should be performed.
pt: Energy difference, divided by the reference momentum times the velocity of light.
range: The TWISS calculation is restricted to the specified range.
rmatrix: If this flag is used the the one-turn map at the location of every element is calculated and prepared for storage in the twiss table.
sectoracc: Save composition of maps instead of individual maps of a sector map.
sectorfile: Name of the file to which the SECTORMAP is written.
sectormap: Initiate the calculation of a sector map.
sectorpure: Save the transfer map Rij without effects from higher order map (Tijk).
sectortable: Name of the table containing the SECTORMAP values.
sequence: Name of a valid sequence for which the calculation of optical functions should be performed.
useorbit: Use the start value provided for the closed orbit search.

sequence: Name of the sequence to be loaded and expanded.
period: Name of the sequence to be loaded and expanded.

name: NAME
String
Name of the parameter or attribute to be varied
step: Approximate initial step size for varying the parameter

sigx: The horizontal extent of the opposite beam.
sigy: The vertical extent of the opposite beam.
xma: The horizontal displacement of the opposite beam with respect to the ideal orbit.
yma: The vertical displacement of the opposite beam with respect to the ideal orbit.
charge: The charge of particles in the opposite beam in elementary charges.
bbshape: The parameter to choose the radial density shape of the opposite beam.
width: The relative extent of the edge region.
bbdir: The direction of motion of the opposite beam relative to the beam considered.

rv1: Number of initial turns with zero voltage.
rv2: Number of turns to ramp voltage from zero to nominal.
rv3: Number of turns with nominal voltage.
rv4: Number of turns to ramp voltage from nominal to zero.
rph1: Number of initial turns with nominal phase.
rph2: Number of turns to ramp phase [2$\pi$] from nominal to specified value.
lagf: Value of the final crab RF phase lag

e1: The rotation angle for the pole face.
hgap: Half gap height of the associated SBEND
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l: The length of the closed orbit corrector.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l: The length of the closed orbit corrector.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

lrad: A fictitious length, which was originally just used to compute synchrotron radiation effects.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
knl: The normal multipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.
ksl: The skew multipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.

tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
The roll angle about the longitudinal axis
thick: If this logical flag is set to true the quadrupole is tracked through as a thick-element, instead of being converted into thin-lenses.

tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
e1: The rotation angle for the entrance pole face.
e2: The rotation angle for the exit pole face.
fint: The fringe field integral at the entrance and exit of the bend.
fintx: If defined and positive, the fringe field integral at the exit of the element, overriding FINT for the exit.
hgap: The half gap of the magnet.
h1: The curvature of the entrance pole face.
h2: The curvature of the exit pole face.
add_angle: An array of (maximum 5) bending angles for multiple passes.
thick: If this logical flag is set to true the bending magnet will be tracked through as a thick-element, instead of being converted into thin-lenses.

lrad: A fictitious length, which was originally just used to compute synchrotron radiation effects.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
ksl: The skew rfmultipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.
pnl: The phase for each normal rfmultipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.
psl: The phase for each skew rfmultipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.

tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
e1: The rotation angle for the entrance pole face.
e2: The rotation angle for the exit pole face.
fint: The fringe field integral at the entrance and exit of the bend.
fintx: If defined and positive, the fringe field integral at the exit of the element, overriding FINT for the exit.
hgap: The half gap of the magnet.
h1: The curvature of the entrance pole face.
h2: The curvature of the exit pole face.
thick: If this logical flag is set to true the bending magnet will be tracked through as a thick-element, instead of being converted into thin-lenses.

tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l: The length of the closed orbit corrector.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

command_beam.title: beam
command_beam.description: The BEAM statement defines data for the particles in a beam.

command_twiss.title: twiss
command_twiss.description: Compute Twiss parameters and set initial conditions.

BEAMBEAM.title: BGGEXP
BEAMBEAM.description: A straight magnetic field element using generalized gradient expansion.

DRIFT.title: DRIFT
DRIFT.description: A drift space implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order

HKICKER.title: HKICKER
HKICKER.description: A horizontal steering dipole implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order.

HMONITOR.title: HMONITOR
HMONITOR.description: A horizontal position monitor, accepting a rpn equation for the readout as a function of the actual position (x).

KICKER.title: KICKER
KICKER.description: A combined horizontal-vertical steering magnet implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order. For time-dependent kickers, see BUMPER.

MARKER.title: MARKER
MARKER.description: A marker, equivalent to a zero-length drift space.

MONITOR.title: MONITOR
MONITOR.description: A two-plane position monitor, accepting two rpn equations for the readouts as a function of the actual positions (x and y).

OCTUPOLE.title: OCTUPOLE
OCTUPOLE.description: An octupole implemented as a third-order matrix

QUADRUPOLE.title: QUAD
QUADRUPOLE.description: A quadrupole implemented as a matrix, up to 3rd order.

RFCAVITY.title: RFCAVITY
RFCAVITY.description: A first-order matrix RF cavity with exact phase dependence.

SBEND.title: SBEND
SBEND.description: A canonical kick sector dipole magnet.

SEXTUPOLE.title: SEXTUPOLE
SEXTUPOLE.description: A sextupole implemented as a matrix, up to 3rd order

SOLENOID.title: SOLENOID
SOLENOID.description: A solenoid implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order.

VKICKER.title: VKICKER
VKICKER.description: A vertical steering dipole implemented as a matrix, up to 2nd order.

VMONITOR.title: VMONITOR
VMONITOR.description: A vertical position monitor, accepting a rpn equation for the readout as a function of the actual position (y).
